author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Needs a `[compat]` section in `Project.toml` with at least an entry for `julia` itself, e.g.:
```toml
[compat]
julia = "1"
```
would mean that the package is compatible with Julia versions `[1.0.0, 2.0.0)`.

This is a bit of a generic name. Perhaps something a bit more descriptive `ThreadedReductions` or `ThreadedMapReduce`?

I've added the `[compat]` section for julia (no dependencies).

I agree thet the name is a bit too generic. Originally, I called the package `ThreadedMap`, but over the time as I added more functions the name was less and less fitting. I thought about something like `ThreadedFunctions` but that seemed too general. `ThreadedMapReduce` on the other hand seems unfitting because there are more functions than just the two... (And I can see more yet to come). So far, I've been mainly thinking about [functions on iterable collections](https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1.2/base/collections/#Iterable-Collections-1), so maybe something like `ThreadedIterables`?
Are you happy with the name @marekdedic ?

@fredrikekre Which one? :smile: I think @StefanKarpinski had some (correct) remarks about it being too general, so I proposed some alternatives, hoping for a guidance on which would fix the ecosystem the best...

Personally, I like `ThreadedCollections` the best.

`ThreadedIterables` is also good.
